paper_abstract: We present a fully polynomial time approximation scheme (FPTAS) for minimizing an objective (a(X)(T) + gamma) (b(X)(T) + delta) under linear constraints Ax <= d. Examples of such problems are combinatorial minimum weight product problems such as, e.g., the following: Given a graph G = (V, E) and two edge weights a, b : E -> R+ find an s-t path P that minimizes a(P)b(P), the product of its edge weights relative to a and b.
paper_title: Quadratic programming and combinatorial minimum weight product problems
